critique: The executive order seems to be a technical document concerning civil service employment. It is unlikely to evoke strong emotions. The order primarily aims to inform and direct government employees. Therefore, the scores for all emotions should be relatively low. I will set joy, sadness, anger, fear, disgust, and surprise all to 1 initially. After further consideration, I don't think any emotion is intended to be conveyed, so I will keep all scores at 1.
